sentences: Tema on segi tema enda sünnipäevaga.
Me ei tea, kes on segi selles asjas.
Lapsed olid segi oma uute mänguasjadega.
context: In Estonian, 'segi' is an adjective that means confused or mixed up. It describes a state of being mentally disoriented or physically entangled. The word can be used to describe people who are uncertain about something or things that are jumbled together without proper order.
